div.div: This search form uses an instant search feature. As you type, search results will appear automatically below the search field. When you've entered you desired search terms use tab to navigate through the available results and hit enter to open the selected page or document.

div.p: The CPS Distance Learning website is up and running. On this site, you will be able to choose your student's education level, school, grade and then teacher. Here you will...

Close of the 2019-2020 School Year1. Columbus High School Graduation: August 2, 2020 at 3:00 p.m. Graduation will occur on August 2, 2020 in one of three ways:...

Event: Golf: Boys Varsity vs. Lincoln Southeast (Away)

div.p:
Seniors we know that you have been on the edge of your seat wondering about Honors Night, Prom & Graduation. Follow this link to the CHS announcement and plans: https://www.columbuspublicschools.org/article/232196?org=columbushighschool
#AlwaysADiscoverer view image

Senior Parents,
Alpha Media would like you to submit your seniors for their Senior Highlight. You can do so at https://www.mycentralnebraska.com/columbus-high-school-seniors/ .
This is one more way to highlight the hard work of our CHS soon to be graduates.

All Lunch Program Locations are Monday-Thursday. On Thursdays you will receive meals for Friday.
CHS, CMS, Centennial, Emerson, Lost Creek, North Park & West Park 10am-1pm
Duncan, Village Hall 11am-1pm
Carriage House Estates, Park 7th Ave & 27th St 1pm-2pm
view image

Lunch Program update: Beginning today CPS will also be delivering Grab & Go Lunches/Breakfasts out to Carriage House Estates.The pick up will be from 1pm-2pm Monday - Thursday and will be located at the park on 7th ave & 27th street. view image

At the recommendation of ECDHD, Columbus Public School Buildings will remain closed, and we will begin extended learning on March 30th through April 30th. For more information and details visit https://www.columbuspublicschools.org/article/218236?org=district-administration view image

Columbus Public Schools
2508 27th St.
Columbus, NE 68601

div.p: The Columbus Public School District does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, marital status, age or handicap in admission or access to, or the treatment in its programs and activities.

Parents may request information regarding the professional qualifications of their studentâ€™s teacher (s). The request may be made to Jason Harris, Director of Student Services, at harrisj@discoverers.org.
Once the request is made, the district will provide the requested information in a timely manner.
